title: What is the best way for a group of people to share music? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am one of the co-founders of doctape.com - With doctape you can upload your files and they are converted into web ready formats. Sharing your music with your friends securely is easy: Just upload your music. For example some .mp3 or .wav files and they are converted in realtime into mp3's (if necessary). Now you can play them instantly in any browser and share them privately or if you want publicly with your friends. Doctape has the concept of "tapes" which are effectivly special tags that let you bundle a group of files you want to share. Best of all: You can make your tape a live tape and all friends you share with can add files to your tape. If you want to know more you can watch our introductory video at http://www.doctape.com are use this invite token to get direct access to the service: http://www.doctape.com/f4kfwd
The best solution to date is SoundCloud (product). It offers all of this functionality, and anything that you do choose to go public can be presented in a really smart player.
